snippet: The investigator, Glenn Mulcaire, was ordered to disclose the identity of those who had commissioned him to intercept voice mail messages on behalf of The News of the World.
abstract: Glenn Mulcaire, a private investigator who has been a central player in Britain’s phone hacking scandal loses a bid at the Supreme Court to remain silent about who commissioned him to intercept voice mail messages on behalf of The News of the World; he had argued that he had a right to remain silent about who commissioned him to avoid self-incrimination.
lead_paragraph: The investigator, Glenn Mulcaire, was ordered to disclose the identity of those who had commissioned him to intercept voice mail messages on behalf of The News of the World.

headline.seo: Judges Rule Against Private Investigator in British Hacking Scandal
headline.main: Judges Rule Against Private Investigator in British Hacking Scandal
headline.print_headline: Britain: Detective in Hacking Case Can’t Remain Silent, Court Rules

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
